meanings.definition: A large farm or ranch in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The family worked together on the rancho to grow crops and raise animals.
meanings.sent2: The rancho stretched as far as the eye could see, with cattle grazing in the fields.
meanings.sent3: The rancho was so big, it took a whole day just to walk from one end to the other!
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were a vast rancho of possibilities, waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The rancho was a bustling community of hardworking people, each with their own role to play.

meanings.definition: A simple dwelling or hut, especially in the southwestern United States.
meanings.sent1: The old cowboy lived in a small rancho at the edge of the desert.
meanings.sent2: The rancho was made of adobe bricks and had a thatched roof.
meanings.sent3: The rancho may have been tiny, but it was cozy and full of character.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, the rancho stood like a lone island in a sea of sand.
meanings.sent5: The rancho was a humble abode, but it provided shelter from the scorching sun.
